snippet: The new regulation, which was proposed on Friday, seeks to inflict the costs of a failure on investors who have lent to an ailing bank and on its shareholders, rather than on taxpayers.
abstract: Federal Reserve proposes new rule requiring banks to have larger financial reserves that could handle potential losses on loans and trading positions; move would put costs of failure on investors and shareholders, instead of taxpayers.
